intro: Tieghemopanax pulchellus, commonly known as the golden tree, is a striking tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its smooth, golden-yellow bark and large, palmate leaves that can reach up to 1 meter in diameter. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by orange or red berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its unique appearance and ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
